ArticleTitle.sentence: Stimulation of HIV replication in mononuclear phagocytes by leukemia inhibitory factor.

event.clue: Stimulation of HIV replication in mononuclear phagocytes by leukemia inhibitory factor.
Stimulation of HIV replication in mononuclear phagocytes by leukemia inhibitory factor.

AbstractText.sentence: This study examined the effects of leukemia inhibitory factor (LIF) on human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) replication in mononuclear phagocytes (MNP).

event.clue: This study examined the effects of leukemia inhibitory factor (LIF) on human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) replication in mononuclear phagocytes (MNP).

AbstractText.sentence: LIF induced a dose-dependent increase in p24 antigen production in the chronically infected promonocytic cell line U1.

event.clue: LIF induced a dose-dependent increase in p24 antigen production in the chronically infected promonocytic cell line U1.

AbstractText.sentence: The magnitude and time kinetics of the LIF effects were similar to interleukin 1 (IL-1), IL-6, and tumor necrosis factor (TNF), other cytokines known to induce HIV replication in this cell line.

AbstractText.sentence: To characterize mechanisms responsible for these LIF effects, levels of HIV mRNA, activation of the DNA binding protein nuclear factor (NF)-kB, signal transduction pathways, and potential interactions with other cytokines were analyzed.

event.clue: To characterize mechanisms responsible for these LIF effects, levels of HIV mRNA, activation of the DNA binding protein nuclear factor (NF)-kB, signal transduction pathways, and potential interactions with other cytokines were analyzed.

AbstractText.sentence: LIF increased steady-state levels of HIV mRNA at 2.0, 4.3, and 9.2 kB.

event.clue: LIF increased steady-state levels of HIV mRNA at 2.0, 4.3, and 9.2 kB.

AbstractText.sentence: This was detectable by 24 h and persisted until 72 h.
The DNA binding protein NF-kB is a central mediator in cytokine activation of HIV transcription.

AbstractText.sentence: NF-kB levels were higher in unstimulated U1 cells as compared to the parent cell line U937.
In both cell lines LIF increased NF-kB activity.

AbstractText.sentence: Induction of NF-kB and HIV replication by cytokines are at least in part dependent on reactive oxygen intermediates.

AbstractText.sentence: The oxygen radical scavenger N-acetyl-L-cysteine, but not an inhibitor of nitric oxide synthase, inhibited LIF-induced HIV replication.

AbstractText.sentence: LIF induces the production of other cytokines in monocytes but its effects on HIV replication were not inhibited by antibodies to IL-1, TNF, or IL-6.
